author: Vietstock
title: Viettel opens largest data center in Vietnam to support AI development | Vietstock
text: Viettel opens largest data center in Vietnam to support AI development Viettel opens largest data center in Vietnam to support AI development By 2025, Viettel will invest in expanding the scale to 17,000 racks. Viettel, the military-owned telecommunications service provider, inaugurated its new data center in Hanoi's Hoa Lac Hi-tech Park, the largest in Vietnam, on April 10. | | Viettel's new data center in Hoa Lac Hi-tech Park. Photo: Viettel It is the country's first high-capacity data center, three times larger than the average, to meet the development trend of AI, which requires high-performance chips and increased computing power. With the addition of the 14th data center, Viettel has a total of 230,000 servers, 81,000 square meters of floor space, 11,500 racks, and 87MW of electricity, equivalent to a global super data center. Speaking at the opening of the data center, Minister of Information and Communications Nguyen Manh Hung urged Viettel to continue to invest in building larger and world-class data centres. He also called on Vietnamese organisations and enterprises to make greater use of Vietnam's data center services and cloud computing, especially as Vietnam's infrastructure and services meet the highest global standards and offer competitive prices. The Ministry of Information and Communications will draft a decree to guide the Telecommunications Law, which will require data from state agencies to be stored in Vietnam, the minister said. He noted that investment in data centres is a new investment trend for telecom network operators as it opens up new growth opportunities. Viettel is the largest data center provider in Vietnam with a total capacity of 87MW. This is also Viettel's commitment to building Vietnam's international standard digital infrastructure and the realization of Viettel's digital infrastructure mission, he said. "The ministry highly appreciates Viettel's direction to invest in data centers with special designs to be ready for the potential AI infrastructure, apply green technology and save energy," the minister added. Viettel Chairman and CEO Tao Duc Thang said that according to the roadmap, Viettel will invest in expanding the scale to 17,000 racks by 2025. "By 2030, Viettel will further expand the scale to 34,000 racks. The Group is ready to work with Vietnamese enterprises to unleash the power of cloud computing," he pledged. The Group's data center holds various green certifications, including energy management, environmental impact management and occupational health and safety management standards. It is also the first data center to commit to sourcing 30% of its electricity from renewable sources. HSBC has certified Viettel's data center as eligible for green credit. The military-owned company plans to build the largest data center in Vietnam with a total investment of VND6 trillion (US$261.8 million) in the Hoc Mon and Cu Chi districts of Ho Chi Minh City.

author: world today news
title: Ukraine bans officials and soldiers from using Telegram – 2024-09-26 17:50:13
text:
He National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine This Friday, the US banned its officials and soldiers from using Telegram on their work devices to prevent cyberattacks and information theft by Russia through this messaging platform.
“To minimize these threats, the decision has been taken to prohibit the installation and use of Telegram “in official devices of State authorities, military personnel, employees of the security and defence sector and companies in charge of critical infrastructures,” the Council’s statement reads.
According to this Ukrainian state body, which includes the heads of the main military and security structures and other strategic institutions, “ Telegram It is actively used by the enemy for cyber attacks, for the distribution of phishing and malware, and for establishing the geolocation of users, directing missile attacks, etc.”
The ban does not apply to civil servants, military personnel and members of security structures in charge of informing and communicating with the Ukrainian population, including Telegram It is the most popular messaging platform and the main means of obtaining information and receiving notifications.
Ukraine: Russian “strike capabilities” reduced in Donetsk On the other hand, the Ukrainian president, Volodímir Zelenski said in his address to the nation last night that his armed forces have managed to weaken Russian assault capabilities in the region of Donetsk from the east of Ukraine thanks in part to the Ukrainian military operation in the Russian Oblast of Kursk which would have forced Moscow to move some 40,000 soldiers there.
“The Armed Forces of Ukraine have now managed to reduce the assault capabilities of the occupiers in the region of Donetsk “, said Zelenski which acknowledged however that “the situation remains extremely difficult” in the area, especially on the axes of You dare y Pokrovsk .
Zelenski He added that the Ukrainian army “has already managed to divert some 40,000 troops” to the Russian region of Kursk where kyiv launched its most ambitious cross-border operation of this war on August 6 and has dozens of towns under its control.
Force a Russia to transfer a substantial part of the troops it uses to try to advance in eastern Ukraine is one of the declared objectives of the invasion of Russian territory launched by Kiev which, according to what he said Zelenski is also managing to capture a large number of Russian prisoners of war who are then exchanged for Ukrainian captives.
The Ukrainian president also explained, without giving further details, that Ukraine is preparing “detailed and substantial negotiations” with its partners that have to do with the situation of Donetsk and other areas of the front.
According to the latest bulletin of the Center for Defense Strategies in kyiv, Ukraine has managed to stop the counteroffensive launched by Russia to recover territory in Kursk and continues to gain ground in some areas of the territory it controls in this Russian region.
At the same time, the Ukrainian think tank also says it has identified slight Russian advances in certain areas of the axes of In Lima , Pokrovsk , Toretsk y You dare .
Russian air defenses shoot down eight drones over the border region of Belgorod Russian air defenses shot down eight Ukrainian drones over the border region of Belgrade the country’s Defense Ministry reported on Friday.
“Last night an attempt by the regime of Kiev to carry out a terrorist attack using drones against targets on the territory of the Russian Federation Russia “, the military note states.
The governor of the neighboring region of Kursk , Alexei Smirnov reported the downing of a Ukrainian missile last night.
Russia continues its counteroffensive in Kursk to expel enemy troops that broke into that region on August 6.
According to the Russian military, more than 10 towns in the region have already been liberated, although the Ministry of Defense acknowledges in its daily reports that the forces of Kiev They have not given up on their attempts to expand their presence in Russian territory, including through new incursions that are repelled.
Ukraine shoots down 61 of 70 drones launched by Russia On the other hand, Ukrainian air defenses shot down 61 Shahed kamikaze drones out of a total of 70 launched by Russian forces in a new massive night attack over the territory of 13 of the country’s 24 oblasts, the Ukrainian Air Force reported in its Friday statement.
These unmanned devices, which Russia acquired from its Iranian partners, were launched from the territories of Primorsko-Ajtarsk , Kursk y Yeisk all of them in the Russian Federation and near the border with Ukraine.
In addition to the drones, Russia launched three missiles against the region of Donetsk in Ukraine eastern Ukraine, and attacked the Ukrainian region of Dnipropetrovsk (center).
Apart from in Dnipropetrovsk air defenses were activated during the attack in the Kyiv (northern), Cherkasi, Kirovograd and Poltava (central) oblasts, Vienna, Ivano-Frankivsk, Yemelnitsky y Lviv (west), Sumi (northeast) and Mykolaiv , Odessa y Kherson (south). EFE
#Ukraine #bans #officials #soldiers #Telegram

author: Redacción Correo
title: Gobierno Regional de La Libertad inicia reconstrucción de cuatro centros de salud en Trujillo
text: El Gobierno Regional de [La Libertad ](https://diariocorreo.pe/edicion/la-libertad/la-libertad-ratifican-sancion-a-la-comuna-de-trujillo-por-graves-infracciones-a-la-ley-general-de-la-persona-con-discapacidad-noticia/)se ha visto favorecidao con uno de los mayores presupuestos para Obras por Impuestos, con un tope de 1,048 millones de soles. En esa línea, una importante suma de más de 70 millones de soles ya vienen siendo utilizados en la ejecución de los primeros cuatro centros de salud de la provincia de Trujillo. VER MÁS:[Trujillo: Migraciones detecta a dos requisitoriados que pretendían sacar pasaporte y los entrega a la Policía] Esta buen noticia representa un gran impulso para seguir mejorando y modernizando los servicios de infraestructuras que llevaban décadas en muy mal estado, afectando la atención de los pacientes y usuarios por las diversas deficiencias. Lo más importante es que el GORE los ha priorizado en la cartera de Obras por Impuestos, tendiendo sus buenas relaciones con las empresas para que apuesten por estos trabajos. Centros de salud en Moche y Víctor Larco De acuerdo a la Gerencia Regional de Cooperación Técnica y Promoción de la Inversión Privada, los cuatro centros de salud donde se ha iniciado son los siguientes: centro de salud Jacobo Effio (Moche) por 22.8 millones de soles, centro de salud Buenos Aires (Víctor Larco) por 16.3 millones de soles, centro de salud San Pedro (Las Delicias) por 15.7 millones de soles, y centro de salud Huamán (Víctor Larco) por 16.4 millones de soles. En todos esos establecimientos ya se ha hecho la entrega de terreno a las empresas financistas, las mismas que vienen avanzando con la elaborando de los expedientes técnicos, que se calcula en un periodo de 4 meses, para luego proceder con su ejecución física, donde se estima que deberán terminarse un plazo de 8 meses, es decir, para fines de 2025 podrán ser inaugurados. En el caso del centro de salud Jacobo Effio, la empresa financista es Ferreyros SA, y su reconstrucción beneficiará a 1,400 habitantes. El caso de Buenos Aires es el consorcio Spectrum - Buenos Aires, que beneficia a 1,800 habitantes; en San Pedro es el consorcio Spectrum – San Pedro, que beneficia a 1,700 habitantes; y en Huamán es el consorcio Spectrum – Huamán, que beneficia a 4,300 habitantes. TE PUEDE INTERESAR: [Delincuentes detonan dinamita en farmacia y taller de mecánica, en Trujillo](https://diariocorreo.pe/edicion/la-libertad/la-libertad-retiran-a-un-hombre-que-habia-improvisado-un-dormitorio-en-un-parque-en-huanchaco-noticia/?ref=dcr)[Solicitan la donación de estación meteorológica para Trujillo, a fin de mejorar trabajo de prevención](https://diariocorreo.pe/edicion/la-libertad/la-libertad-solicitan-la-donacion-de-estacion-meteorologica-para-trujillo-a-fin-de-mejorar-trabajo-de-prevencion-noticia/)[La Libertad: Búsqueda de petróleo en Salaverry no se detiene](https://diariocorreo.pe/edicion/la-libertad/la-libertad-busqueda-de-petroleo-en-salaverry-no-se-detiene-noticia/) .
